intro: Hedyotis lancifolia var. brevipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to regions of Asia, including China and India, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
